author: henning
msg: Fixed up the facade and interface class to match the various public

author: henning
msg: This is a complete rewrite of the Template Service. Whoever wrote this
thing: Please I'd like to have some of that stuff. :-)
I ripped out the various templating "policies", replaced them with an
uniform template mapper model, cleaned up the various methods dealing
with the defaults, unified the caching and keeping of objects,
reworked the template extension registration, dealt with various corner
cases concerning the template, path and class separators, factored out
the separator types into constants and very much more.
One ToDo item stays (I don't need this and I'm too lazy. ;-) ) One
could unify the various registerMapper(new ...) in initTemplateMapper
by creating interface classes (new PageMapper(), new ScreenMapper(),
new LayoutMapper() and then make these pluggable from the properties.
So one could very easy change the mapping strategies e.g. for layouts
or classes by configuring it with new mapper classes in the props. As I
said: I don't need it, if you need it, feel free to ask. :-)
Ah yes, and the docs are now terribly out of date.

author: henning
msg: This mapper provides the matching path names for screens. It replaces
the template separators by path separators and tests if a given template
exists in the TemplateEngineService selected by the extension. If yes,
returns the path name, if no returns null.
